issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: The User Console will not display the tags of instances (added at launch through the launch wizard), once we get to 110+ instances.
fields.summary: User Console Unable To Display Tags Associated With Large Number of Instances

comments.body: There is no fix at the moment. I guess I missed that this was targetet to 3.4.3 amidst the 4.0 rush. I'll have a look at this soon. My biggest problem is where to run 110+ instances. Thoughts? I could run that many micros on AWS if that's OK.
ok, np.. could use the DanNC for this!
Firing up test cloud to over-commit for 128 m1.smalls

I'm having trouble getting instances to run in this over-commit state. Likely due to 128MB of RAM for the micro. I have seen the problem in instances in the pending state, but I used euca-describe-tags and there weren't any tags listed, so that would explain that specific case. Since tags are removed when an instance goes from pending->shutting down, I have to be quick to see a large number of instances in pending. [~viglesias] is there an image you know of with very small memory/disk requirements that I might get running?

[~dkavanagh]

You can try this uber small Cirros Image:
http://mirror.eucalyptus-systems.com/images/test-images/cirrosraw.img

I created the situation by launching 99 instances with 2 tags assigned. I don't see the tags in the UI. I tried to verify tags using euca2ools and there are no tags assigned to any of the instances.
I noticed I never saw any positive notification that the run succeeded. I eventually saw the instances appear in the table. I suspect that the run instance command timed out without an error and we never created the tags (which would normally happen after a successful run instance response since we then have the resource ids).

I've verified that tags created for small numbers of instances being launched do get created properly. I'll have to investigate the failure mode to see if there is anything we can do about it. It seems the CLC takes way too long to respond to the request and we can't create the tags.

after instrumenting, I see that I do get back success running 99 instances, but tags weren't being created. There is a closure that has the tags, but in the callback for success, that value is an empty array. Need to track that down since this value should not be cleared as the scope should still be held while the code is executing.

got it. The closure contained a reference to the array. Created a copy of that with slice() and now tags are properly created. I think we had a race condition where if the run command returned fast enough, the array wasn't garbage collected. Now, we're ensured the array will be there.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/257

I tested this out throughly on the http://10.111.1.120/euca-qa/display_test.php?testname=david-3.4.2-cloud&uid=1007 cloud which I'll leave up for you to use for testing. It can run up to 124 instances as t1.micros with the cirrus image.
[~dkavanagh] great detective work!  Make sure this goes back to 3.4 maintenance, 4.0 maintenance, and 4.1 testing :)
This problem won't affect 4.0 or later code. The fix was merged into the maint/3.4/testing
Tested with 198 instances. 99 with 2 tags and 99 with 3 tags.
